intro: Crepis merxmuelleri, commonly known as the Merxmueller's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this species thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and is often found in alpine meadows. Its name reflects its resemblance to the mouse-ear plant, with leaves that are broad and rounded.
